title: Black Panther Quotes About Revolution
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: Collection of Black Panther Party revolutionary quotes with analysis, connecting colonial analysis to modern understanding of power structures

framework.inspiration: Algerian Liberation Front (FLN) against French occupation
framework.key_insight: Local police = occupying army equivalent in colonial situation
framework.transposition: Black Community treated as internal colony of America

three_elements_of_colony.indigenous_bourgeois: Works hand in hand with imperialists

three_classes_of_evil.police: Gestapo - local police enforcing colonial control

black_bourgeois_collaboration.role: Belong to political parties of mother country
black_bourgeois_collaboration.function: Carry out political programs of mother country parties

education_and_revolution.thesis: Revolution without education leads to new oppression

jomo_kenyatta.action: Formed Kenyan Revolution with no education
jomo_kenyatta.outcome: Told people 'I'm your brother' then became oppressor

papa_doc_haiti.action: Hated everything white, expelled white people
papa_doc_haiti.reason: No education to understand true enemy

correct_understanding.right: Hate the OPPRESSOR - whether white, black, brown, or yellow

educational_program_necessity.warning: Without education, leaders will steal money (not understanding it's 'the people's thing anyway')
educational_program_necessity.risk: Poor people wanting something → wanting more → becoming capitalists → black imperialists

education_and_revolution.judgment_timing: No one can judge if Castro is Revolutionary yet - we're talking about the END

current_state.misunderstanding: Think black people are causing their problems
current_state.quote: All those riots are causing my life to be miserable

awakening_the_people.not_focused_on: The pigs and their lynchers - the power structure

the_power_structure.description: Bald headed businessmen at the chamber of commerce
the_power_structure.responsibility: Making life increasingly miserable for everybody
the_power_structure.crimes: Responsible for sons being murdered in Vietnam

awakening_the_people.prediction: When they find out who's really causing trouble, they'll be just like the Panthers

german_jewish_parallel.statement: They have shown by their actions that they intend to play the role of the Germans
german_jewish_parallel.response: We need to show by our actions that we do not intend to play the role of the Jews
german_jewish_parallel.meaning: Active resistance rather than passive victimhood

spirit_over_technology.thesis: Spirit of the people greater than all government technology

clarification.the_problem: Psychological structure of racists who control the country from its beginning

spirit_over_technology.reagan_challenge: I want to challenge him to a duel

law_and_order_critique.context: 20th century after Hitler, after demonstrations, after assassinations
law_and_order_critique.reagan_position: Avowed racist saying 'let's continue this same old shit'
law_and_order_critique.law_and_order_translation: Slavery, Suffering and Death for Black People

choice_presented.option_1: Oppose pigs and power structure - draw firm line, push them against wall
choice_presented.question: Can you oink to the Star Spangled Banner?

quiz_questions.q: What insight did the Black Panthers gain from studying the Algerian Liberation Front?
quiz_questions.a: Local police departments are the colonial occupying army equivalent
quiz_questions.explanation: FLN analysis of French army transposed to American context

quiz_questions.q: According to Fred Hampton, why did Jomo Kenyatta become an oppressor?
quiz_questions.a: No education - didn't understand the true enemy was oppression, not race
quiz_questions.explanation: Education needed to know what the 'finale' should look like

quiz_questions.q: What are the 'three classes of evil' in colonial analysis?
quiz_questions.explanation: These work hand in hand with indigenous bourgeois to maintain control

quiz_questions.q: What did Eldridge Cleaver say about government technology?
quiz_questions.a: The spirit of the people is greater than all of it
quiz_questions.explanation: Psychological oppression is the real enemy, not physical structures

quiz_questions.q: What does 'Law and Order' mean according to Black Panther analysis?
quiz_questions.a: Slavery, Suffering and Death for Black People
quiz_questions.explanation: Coded language for maintaining oppressive status quo

achievement_unlocks: Colonial Analyst: Understand internal colony framework
Education Advocate: Know why education precedes revolution
Power Mapper: Identify the three classes of evil
Spirit Warrior: Understand psychological vs physical oppression
